    • Method Detail

      • contextToPagination

        public static void contextToPagination(int start,
                       int totalRecords,
                       int recordsPerPage)
        Prepared the user context to use data pagination. The following variables are set to the context:

        • totalPages - total number of pages
        • recordsPerPage - how many records will be shown on each page
        • totalRecords - number of records fount
        • thisPage - the current page being shown
        • start -

        Parameters:
        start - int
        totalRecords - int
        recordsPerPage - int

      • contextToLogin

        public static String contextToLogin()
        Prepares the template context to show the login page, using the current URI as return path.
        Returns:
        TemplateKeys.USER_LOGIN

      • contextToLogin

        public static String contextToLogin(String returnPath)
        Prepares the template context to show the login page, using "returnPath" as return path
        Parameters:
        returnPath - the URI to use as return path
        Returns:
        TemplateKeys.USER_LOGIN

      • getStartPage

        public static int getStartPage()
        Returns the initial page to start fetching records from.
        Returns:
        The initial page number

      • getForumLink

        public static String getForumLink()
        Gets the forum base link. The returned link has a trailing slash
        Returns:
        The forum link, with the trailing slash

      • toUtf8String

        public static String toUtf8String(String s)

      • formatDate

        public static String formatDate(Date date)
        Formats a date using the pattern defined in the configuration file. The key is the value of net.jforum.util.preferences.ConfigKeys.DATE_TIME_FORMAT
        Parameters:
        date - the date to format
        Returns:
        the string with the formated date

      • espaceHtml

        public static String espaceHtml(String contents)
        Escapes < by &lt; and > by &gt;
        Parameters:
        contents - the string to parse
        Returns:
        the new string
